page.title: 17CHURCHES OF BECKLEY & HORTON
page.content: St.Barnabas Church, Horton, was built in 1867 by William Butterfield in a similar brick to his Keble College. St.Mary's, Beckley, is basically a Norman church rebuilt in the 14th. Century. At Beckley the bells are unsafe and cannot be rung although early wall paintings have recently been restored. In 1985 a rare Church Court was held when two villagers objected to the placing of a central altar. The Vicar, the Rev.A.de Vere, celebrates Eucharist in both churches each Sunday. Both churchyards are still open for burials although most people are now cremated. Our survey showed that 18.5% attended a place of worship regularly, 5.5% quite often, 31% occasionally, 22% seldom and 22% never.
